decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The roof extension by reason of its scale, siting, massing and design, represents an inappropriate form of development that is overly dominant and intrusive to the detriment of the character and appearance of the host dwelling and an incongruent addition to the streetscene. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), Policy CS 14 of the Merton LDF Core Planning Strategy (2011) and Policies DM D2 & DM D3 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan (2014).

Reason : 2 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The application was not considered to comply with the provisions of the Development Plan and NPPF as submitted, and would have required substantial changes such that a new application would be required. 
"	The application was considered to be fundamentally contrary to the provisions of the Development Plan and the NPPF, and, given the application is to retain works already implemented, there were not considered to be solutions to resolve this conflict. 
"	The applicant is advised to seek pre-application advice on any resubmission.
description: RETENTION OF ROOF EXTENSION AND ASSOCIATED WORKS
